# Arpeggio: 13th in F# (Shape: G)

## Brief Overview
This arpeggio is the 13th arpeggio in the key of F# major, utilizing notes from the G major scale. Arpeggios are broken chords where the notes are played sequentially rather than simultaneously. In this case, the arpeggio creates a rich sound by emphasizing the 13th note in the F# major scale.

- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Major 7th)
- G# (Major 9th)
- B# (Major 11th)
- D# (Major 13th)

The intervals in this arpeggio are as follows:
- Root to Major 3rd: Major 3rd
- Root to Perfect 5th: Perfect 5th
- Root to Major 7th: Major 7th
- Root to Major 9th: Major 9th
- Root to Major 11th: Major 11th
- Root to Major 13th: Major 13th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, with its inclusion of the 13th note, adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to the music. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and other genres where complex harmonies are appreciated. The sound created by this arpeggio is lush and colorful, perfect for creating lush textures and embellishing chord progressions with a touch of elegance.
